final_report.root_cause: The geo service process crashed on startup because it attempted to connect to MongoDB on port 27777 while the mongodb-geo Service/endpoints expose MongoDB on the standard port 27017. The port mismatch caused the DB client to report 'no reachable servers', the application panicked during initializeDatabase (panic at cmd/geo/db.go:26 -> main.main), and the container entered CrashLoopBackOff. The immediate fix is to align the geo pod's MongoDB connection configuration to use port 27017 (or change the mongodb-geo Service to expose 27777).
affected_resources: deployment/geo (geo pod replicas with same config)
final_report.evidence_summary: 1) Pod logs from geo-6b4b89b5f5-qvwnt show the service reads DB URL 'mongodb-geo:27777' and immediately fails with 'no reachable servers' followed by a panic stack trace at cmd/geo/db.go:26 -> main.main. 2) kubectl describe service/mongodb-geo shows endpoints listening on 10.244.1.14:27017 (MongoDB is available on 27017). 3) The container repeatedly restarts (CrashLoopBackOff) with restart_count=11 and exit consistent with an application panic rather than OOM or probe kills. These facts demonstrate a port/configuration mismatch (27777 vs 27017) causing the connectivity failure and crash loop.
final_report.investigation_summary: Priority-1 investigation retrieved pod logs and termination behavior for geo-6b4b89b5f5-qvwnt and established the container panicked on DB connection failure (no reachable servers). Priority-2 investigation compared the geo pod's configured DB URL/port with the mongodb-geo Service definition and endpoints and found a mismatch: geo targeted port 27777 while Service endpoints used 27017. Correlating the two findings gives a direct causal chain: geo configured to use the wrong MongoDB port -> DB client cannot reach any server -> initializeDatabase panics -> container crashes repeatedly. No evidence was found of node-level issues, OOM, or probe failures. The investigation completed with sufficient evidence to localize the root cause to the geo pod's DB port configuration.
